definition: to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
to overflow/to ripple/used in place names/see 漾濞[Yang4 bi4]

sentences.english: Throw a stone into still water and watch the ripples spread in rings .
sentences.chinese: 投一块石头到静止的水里，看涟漪荡漾成圈。

sentences.english: Because thy name moves right in what they say.
sentences.chinese: 一声声都有你的名字在荡漾。

sentences.english: Fitness undulated in the face of people happy smile.
sentences.chinese: 健身的人们脸上荡漾着快乐的笑容。

sentences.english: As I inhale the impalpable breezes that set in upon me.
sentences.chinese: 迎隐晦之风我猛吸气轻风荡漾心旗。

sentences.english: The island canyon scenery looks endlessly, the echo ripples between the white clouds.
sentences.chinese: 岛峡风光看不尽啦，回声荡漾白云间喽。

sentences.english: The green grass, such as the heart ripple swing with the wind.
sentences.chinese: 岸边的绿草随风摆动，如心儿荡漾。

sentences.english: He sat the water all about him green-blue.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在碧波荡漾的水中。

sentences.english: We hugged each other tightly with great joy.
sentences.chinese: 你我紧紧相拥任喜悦荡漾。

sentences.english: Bibo Dangyang relieve the river, the radical Longyi running.
sentences.chinese: 河水缓处碧波荡漾，急处龙蛇奔走。

sentences.english: The toy sailboat danced on the pond.
sentences.chinese: 玩具帆船在池塘上荡漾。

sentences.english: One recalls the past semester, we feel an upsurge of agitation.
sentences.chinese: 回忆已往的一学期，咱们心潮荡漾。

sentences.english: Red wine popple sweet in glass.
sentences.chinese: 通透的玻璃杯荡漾着美酒流芳。

sentences.english: Young willows were ethereal, spring breeze so caressing, and birds were chirping in unison.
sentences.chinese: 嫩柳轻飘，春风荡漾，小鸟唧唧地欢唱。

sentences.english: Involuntarily the echoes are gently about the ear.
sentences.chinese: 这种不由自主的回音轻轻的荡漾在耳际。

sentences.english: With the notes being read off one by one, the classroom filled up with a radiant atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 随着纸条一张张念下去，教室里荡漾起明媚的气息。

definition: gleaming reflection of waves in sunlight
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
